subhead: While the papal trip is unlikely to change the balance of power, Vatican diplomacy is expected to reaffirm its commitment to Lebanon's sovereignty and territorial integrity.

title: Russia's former liberal elite adopts the Kremlin's anti-European rhetoric
subhead: Silenced since the start of the war in Ukraine, former Russian liberals have hardened their rhetoric following the collapse of ceasefire negotiations. Once critical of the Kremlin, they now blame Europe, accusing it of fueling the ongoing war.

title: The art of being Oscar Wilde's grandson
subhead: As Ireland prepares to mark the 125th anniversary of Oscar Wilde's death, Merlin Holland, his only living descendant, works in France to protect the memory of a man who was long viewed as scandalous.

title: Paris restaurants with a New York attitude
subhead: The French capital has recently seen a wave of New York-style restaurants spring up, from slice shops to delis and red sauce joints. Parisians are flocking to these spots to savor not only a slice of culinary culture but also the enduring myth of the Big Apple.

Resignation of Andriy Yermak, Zelensky's right-hand man, shocks Ukrainian politics
subhead: The all-powerful head of the presidential administration was deeply unpopular in Ukraine. Yet his departure comes at the worst time, as Kyiv faces mounting pressure from the US to strike a peace deal with Russia.

title: The difficult conversations between Israeli and Palestinian peace activists
subhead: The anti-occupation NGO Combatants for Peace works to organize joint actions between young people living in the West Bank and in Israel. The group faces the challenge of rebuilding trust between both sides, torn apart by two years of war in Gaza.

title: Inside the archives of shoemaker Roger Vivier
subhead: This star shoemaker of the 1930s through the 1990s spent his long career experimenting with all kinds of designs. His archives, a testament to his boundless creativity, are now housed in a Parisian hôtel particulier.
